duties_responsibilities.duty: Provide direct casework services, crisis intervention, and short-term therapy to clients with medical/psychiatric diagnoses.
Perform holistic evaluation of patient/home, develop a plan of care, and initiate discharge planning.
Coordinate and modify the plan of care with the patient, caregiver, case manager, primary physician, and other healthcare team members.
Evaluate patient/home environment, make appropriate referrals, and coordinate social work services.
Review and revise the patient’s social work plan of care, and evaluate interventions and outcomes of social work services.
Participate in patient care inter/multi-disciplinary case conferences and meetings, as well as education and in-service programs.

education_certification.credential: Master’s degree in Social Work from an accredited school of Social Work required.
Valid state driver’s license and auto insurance required.
State social work license e.g. LASW, LSWAA, LCWAIC, or LICSW.
